title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
Hello community!

  here I have a problem with a 15 inch MBP A1707, which does not turn on.
  I checked the voltage, and it's stuck at 5v 0.02 amps for all charging ports.

  So my question is: how can I be sure it's the CD3215 chip?  And which of the 4 chips is faulty ? 

There is no liquid damage, it just happened overnight.

Awaiting your reply,
best regards and thanks !

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
We need some more readings, like PPBUS_G3H, 3V3_G3H_RTC, AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages.

Compare diode mode to ground and voltage on LDOs of all CD3215 chips.

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
Thanks, I will check right now.
just, what does LDO means ?

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
Low Drop Output rails of CD3215 chips.
You will undertsand looking isnide of their block schematics.

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
Hello,
Here are the tension and diode mode requested:

PPBUS_G3H : 12,3V 407 ohm
3V3_G3H_RTC_X : 3,3V 093 ohm
PP1V8_AWAKE : 1.79V 387 ohm
PP3V3_AWAKE : 3.37V 634 ohm
PP1V2_AWAKE : 1.19V 524 ohm
PPVDDCPU_AWAKE : 0.7V 014 ohm
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE : 0.79V  090 ohm
PP1V8_SLPS2R : 1.79V 380 ohm
PP1V1_SLPS2R : 1.09V 140 ohm


LDO from U3100 
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO : 3.3V 468 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA : 1.78V 530 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD : 1.78V OL
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC : 0V 489 ohm (1.1v if I connect the charger on the right port XA).

LDOs from U3200
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO : 3.36V 504 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA : 1.78V 471 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD : 1.79V 480 ohm
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC : 0V 504 ohm (1.1v if I connect the charger on the right port XB).

LDOs from UB300
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO : 3.36V 470 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA : 1.8V 528 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD : 1.79V 482 ohm
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC : 0V 508 ohm (1.1v if I connect the charger on the right port TA).


LDOs from UB400
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO : 3.35V 467 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA : 1.8V 528 ohm
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD : 1.79V 483 ohm
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC : 0V 514 ohm (1.1v if I connect the charger on the right port TB).


What do you think about it ?

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
Looks more like SMC communication problem.
What shows USB-C meter if connect the battery?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and see if tries to start, with battery connected.

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
When the battery is connected to the motherboard, the USB-C meter shows me 5.2V , 0.084 A and 0.44W.

I tried to find the SMC_ONOFF_L on the schematic, but I can't find it. Could you please explain to me what it is and what exactly I should do with it ?

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message: Sorry, is PMU_ONOFF_L in this case; SWK000 pads.

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message: So if I understood your query correctly, you want me to inject 20V on the PMU_ONOFF_L line to see if it tries to turn on. For example on R8015. That's right ?

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
What???
I hope you didn't do that.

Use SWK000 pads, instead of power button!

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message:
No, I didn't do that. 
How can I use this pad if it is under the motherboard when I put it back in the case to connect the battery?
Can I use the R8015 component to do this test?

title: MacBook Pro A1707 820-01814 No Power
message: Solder a cable on PMU_ONOFF_L (any point) and test metalic chassis part...
